did.unittitle: Robert Opie Shepherd Papers Relating to the Democratic Socialists of America
did.abstract: The majority of the collection consists of notebooks recorded by Robert Opie Shepherd, conference materials, event announcements, and publications originating from both local and national sources.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Members of the New American Movement and the Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee merged in 1982, forming the Democratic Socialists of America. The main goals of the movement reflected a desire to create a socialist presence in modern society. The purpose of the various projects and events of the Democratic Socialists was to develop strategies and to educate people. The socialist vision promoted by the movement was one of "feminism, racial equality, labor activism, equitable distribution, non-oppressive relationships, and the popular control of resources and production."

Robert Opie Shepherd became a member of the Pittsburgh Chapter of the New American Movement (NAM) in 1973. This chapter became the Democratic Socialists of America Pittsburgh Local in 1983 after the merger. Robert Opie shepherd actively participated in several DSA committees, projects, and conventions; he recorded minutes of meetings and notes of various DSA events. He served as the 1990 chairperson for the Pittsburgh Local, delegate to several DSA conferences, and as a member of a Democratic Socialists of America fact-finding Nicaraguan tour during January 1983.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The majority of the collection consists of notebooks recorded by Robert Opie Shepherd, conference materials, event announcements, and publications originating from both local and national sources. The collection contains detailed notes and items relevant to Robert Opie Shepherd's active participation in the DSA. He participated in many local events sponsored or supported by the DSA and the Pittsburgh Local. These included voter registration, Women's Day, the Chinese students' democracy movement, and the April 15th Coalition. national DSA projects include the Working Group on Health Care, the American Solidarity Campaign, and various boycotts and rallies to promote socialist issues. He also collected information regarding Michael Harrington (1928 - 1989), founder and former co-chair of the DSA.

As a delegate representing the Pittsburgh Local, he obtained materials from the 1984 regional DSA conferences in Mechanicsburg and Bloomsburg, Pennsylvania. He also collected delegate materials from the 1983 New York, 1984 Philadelphia, 1989 Baltimore, and 1990 Youth National DSA conventions. As a member of the 1983 Nicaraguan delegation, Robert Opie Shepherd recorded and collected information regarding the political and social condition of that country. Included is a series of educational pamphlets regarding health and personal hygiene issued by the Ministerio de Salud of Nicaragua, as well as several brief historical biographies.

The collection contains a series of the Pittsburgh Local's publication, the Allegheny Socialist, and the national Democratic Socialists of America Publication, the Democratic Left. Publications were issued by specific DSA commissions, such as the Environmental, Labor, Religion, Youth, Latino, Afro-American, and Anti-racism Commissions. Robert Opie Shepherd obtained newsletters of DSA locals in Cleveland, Chicago, New York, Kentucky, Central Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, and Reading. Also present are issues of the Socialist Forum, published by the Institute for Democratic Socialism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The DSA frequently sent news articles to the Locals regarding issues of concern for the Democratic Socialists. The subjects of the articles include poverty, abortion rights, candidates, environment, and the role of Socialism in American politics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: DSA members and committees generated several unpublished reports regarding issues of concern for Democratic Socialists. The file contains The Corporate Compromise: A Marxist View of Health Policy,The Ecological Argument for Socialism,Report to National Office,State of the World 1990, and Towards Pay Equity: A Workers Guide to Fighting Wage Discrimination.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Michael Harrington, a respected author and Socialist leader, was a founder and co-chair of the DSA. The file contains articles, a brief outline of accomplishments, obituaries, memorial service announcements as well as general correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
